We keep Tuesday from happening all at once.

I am Director Pippa Marigold, age three and three-quarters, speaking from the porcelain command tub. Every Tuesday, time reverses like a stubborn drain. We train neighborhoods to walk backward with dignity, return borrowed casseroles before they are lent, and keep revolutions gentle.

Fund one calm Tuesday Volunteer in wet socks
Mission Statement

We believe history should be rinsed, not erased.

The Tubside Accord is a non-profit coalition for communities living under Tuesday reversal conditions. We deliver practical aid: memory ribbons, reverse marching drills, and emotional support for adults who suddenly become younger than their own shoes by lunch.

From the desk of Pippa Marigold

"A revolution is just bathwater with purpose. Hold still and let it swirl around the right people."

Programs this quarter

  • Backward Breakfast Brigades: We un-toast bread safely.
  • Nap Amnesty Hotline: No penalties for strategic naps.
  • Diplomatic Rubber Ducks: Mediation kits for tiny regimes.

Impact: 47 neighborhoods now survive Tuesday with fewer existential puddles.

Field Notes

"Before Tubside, my block panicked every Tuesday and re-enacted Monday three times. Now we reverse in a line, hold hands, and somebody always brings dry towels."
Lt. Garen Folds, Former Cynic, Ward 8

"Pippa returned my lost yearbook before I lost it. It had a note inside: 'Hydrate before coup.'"
Maris T., Volunteer Chaplain for Hallway Disputes

Volunteer Openings

We need gentle adults with steady handwriting and a tolerance for toy megaphones. Training includes towel-folding diplomacy and the official Tubside salute (two bubbles, one nod).
